comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @PaulHigin Windows PowerShell 5.1 needs this change as well before this test will pass, right (since the default remoting endpoint still goes to Windows PowerShell)?  If so, I'll change this test to `Pending`

comments.author: PaulHigin
comments.body:
@SteveL-MSFT I thought that we use a new plugin for PowerShell 6.0.  Not sure but I know a new plugin was created for Core.  @JamesWTruher can you comment?

Regarding PowerShell 5.1, the SessionConfig folder should always be created via Windows manifest.  I feel this change is only needed for the case where the folder is inadvertently deleted (through some previous test) or for PowerShell 6.0 when it is never created.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: Sync'd with @PaulHigin off line, this test will still fail because the default endpoint still points to 5.1 which doesn't have the fix to expose `-PowerShellVersion` yet.  Rather than making this test pending, I think it makes sense to have the default remoting to go to 6.0, I'll look into that.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body:
> Rather than making this test pending, I think it makes sense to have the default remoting to go to 6.0, I'll look into that.

@PaulHigin @SteveL-MSFT Will that be a separate PR? If so, I will merge this one.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @daxian-dbw I'm going to make it part of this PR otherwise the test will still fail

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: I'm going to make this test `Pending` as it's blocked by https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/4275

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: @SteveL-MSFT one question before merging the PR: the test in question has been there for a long time, so why did it start to fail recently?

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @daxian-dbw that specific test was added recently by @PaulHigin https://github.com/SteveL-MSFT/PowerShell/commit/7fa0dd054992082787bd1ef7e99bc0f2c9e2a05c

comments.author: PaulHigin
comments.body: It looks like similar implicit remoting tests in Implicit.Remoting.Tests.ps1 are disabled for core and we should do the same for this test.  Is there an Issue for this?
